law.catch_line: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated....

section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Accreditation" means the determination that a program meets quality standards defined by the accrediting agency beyond State child care regulations.
"Accrediting agency" means a State agency or national organization that has developed a recognized accrediting process.
"Credentialing" means the process through which an individual is awarded a professional certificate based on education and experience.
"Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Grant" means a grant that is distributed under subsection (e) of this section.

"Full day" means a period of time during the day that:
Meets the needs of families; and
Is not less than 7 hours or more than 12 hours per day.

"Judy Center" means a site where comprehensive early child care and education services are provided to young children and their families for the purpose of promoting school readiness through collaboration with participating agencies and programs.
"Judy Center Grant" means a grant that is distributed under subsection (d) of this section.
"Local management board" means a local management board as defined under § 8-101(j)(l) of the Human Services Article.
"Program" means the Judith P. Hoyer Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Program established under this section.
There is a Judith P. Hoyer Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Program in the Department.

The purpose of the Program is to promote school readiness through the development and expansion of collaborative approaches to the delivery of high quality, comprehensive, full-day early child care and education programs and family support services.
The Program shall be funded as provided in the State budget.

text.section:
The Department may distribute a Judy Center Grant to a county board if the county board submits an application to the Department that includes:
A memorandum of understanding between the county board, the participating agencies and programs, and, in the discretion of the county board, the local management board that includes:
The terms of the collaboration to be undertaken by the county board, the participating agencies and programs, and, if applicable, the local management board, including the roles and responsibilities of each of these entities; and
A plan for establishing ongoing communication between private service providers and public school early education programs; and
Documentation that shows that:
The Department's Early Childhood Assessment System will be implemented at the Center;
All participating agencies and programs that provide early child care and education services through the Center have voluntarily obtained accreditation or, by the date of the Grant application, have voluntarily initiated and are actively pursuing the process of obtaining accreditation; and
The Center will provide comprehensive, full-day early child care and education services and family support services.

section.section: The Department may distribute an Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Grant to a county board to be used to purchase early child care and education services and family support services from providers that have voluntarily obtained accreditation or have voluntarily initiated and are actively pursuing accreditation.

The Department may distribute an Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Grant to a private provider of early child care and education services to be used:
To assist the provider in voluntarily obtaining accreditation; or
For professional development activities leading to increased competency and appropriate credentialing that is related to early child care and education services.

text.section: The Department may distribute funds to a county board for the purpose of implementing the Department's Early Childhood Assessment System in the county's public schools.

section.section:
The Department shall:
Establish application procedures for obtaining Judy Center Grants and Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Grants as provided under this section;
Supervise and monitor the use of Grant funds distributed under this section; and
Evaluate whether Grant recipients are meeting annual benchmarks established by the Department.
For Judy Center Grants, the Department may award multiyear funding.

text.section:
A county board that is selected to receive a Judy Center Grant or an Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Grant for the purpose of purchasing early child care and education services shall:
Administer the Grant award;
Submit fiscal and program reports as required by the Department; and
Coordinate the involvement of participating agencies and programs in any evaluation process conducted by the Department.

Grants awarded under this section may not be used:
To supplant existing funding for any services provided by participating agencies and programs; or
For capital improvements.

The Department shall select through a competitive bidding process and supervise an evaluator who shall design and implement an evaluation process to measure the effectiveness of:
The Judy Centers; and
Early child care and education services and family support services that are purchased with funds from Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Grants.

The Department shall submit to the Governor and, subject to § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, the General Assembly:
On or before November 1 of each year, a report on the implementation of the Program and the participating agencies and programs, including a description of the Program's and the participating agencies' and programs' expenditures, enrollment, and statewide performance data, including school readiness data disaggregated by program and by jurisdiction; and
On or before January 1, 2004, a separate report that includes an evaluation, based on objective performance criteria established by the Department, of the effectiveness of:
The Judy Centers; and
Early child care and education services and family support services that are purchased with funds from Early Child Care and Education Enhancement Grants.
The Department may adopt regulations as necessary to implement the Program.
